results.title: Tempo: Australia in the 70's [Italan version]
results.creator_credit: Keith Gow, Roland Beckett and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Gives impressions of life and industry in Australia at the beginnings of the 1970’s with the emphasis on the potential for growth and development. Peter Weir co-wrote the script with Keith Gow and Martin Von Borneman was the Director of Photography. Animation by Yoram Gross. The original production has been dubbed in Italian.

results.title: Temple on the hill
results.creator_credit: Kay Rasool, George Wallace-Crabbe and New South Wales Film and Television Office
results.brief_description: The Sikh community have played a role in the Northern Australian community at Woolgoolga, New South Wales since the turn of last century. Initially coming as labourers the Sikh’s, who now have a stronghold in the community, own and run 90% of the banana plantations in the area. This documentary deals with assimilation and identity and uses the example of both a traditional and progressive Sikh family to discuss the difficulties with language, marriage and family responsibilities in changing times. As the mature generations grow old, maintaining a culture becomes increasingly difficult as the younger generations more easily are attracted to and absorbed into Australia’s western lifestyle.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kay Rasool, George Wallace-Crabbe and New South Wales Film and Television Office

results.title: Temperature
results.creator_credit: Ivo Burum, ABC-TV (Australia) and Victorian College of Agriculture and Horticulture
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Growing awareness: Factors in plant production”.
Temperature influences a plant’s growth, and plants have developed strategies to cope with extremes in temperature. In commercial plant production, statistical techniques are used to determine mean temperatures for different areas. Combining temperature and time, gives the concept of ‘heat summation’ measured in ‘degree days’. Crop Modelling uses a computer to combine data on light intensity, temperature and the rate of photosynthesis to determine optimum growing conditions.

results.title: Television: how it works!
results.creator_credit: John Smart and Coronet Instructional Films
results.brief_description: The fundamentals of television broadcasting and reception are shown from transmission by electron beams in a camera to the image on a television screen. Includes operation of a cathode ray tube, an electron gun, deflecting coils, and a synogenerator.
results.description: The fundamentals of television broadcasting and reception are shown from transmission by electron beams in a camera to the image on a television screen. Includes operation of a cathode ray tube, an electron gun, deflecting coils, and a synogenerator.

results.title: Television: behind the scenes
results.brief_description: The number of television licenses in the Federal Republic of Germany has passed the ten million mark. This film takes a look behind the scenes and shows, apart from the technical details, interesting facts about the production of television programs.

results.title: Television system
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Television”
Explains the principles of television broadcasting, from the camera tube at the studio to the receiver. Shows how the image is brokenm down into picture elements, clarifies the procedure of interfacing; explains the function of each component of the video signal, shows how the scanning raster is produced and the image reproduced in shades of black and white on the screen.

results.title: Television receivers
results.creator_credit: Loucks and Norling Studios and McGraw-Hill Text-Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic Television”
Diagrams and live action are used to identify the sections of the receiver circuit and to summarise the functions of the receiver. Explains the specific functions of each section in a typical intercarrier sound receiver circuit, from the antenna and transmission line to the picture tube.

results.title: Television picture tube
results.brief_description: Shows how the electron-beam of the cathode ray tube is made to deflect both horizontally and vertically so that it becomes a scanning device over the face of the television screen. Also shows modulation of intensity of the beam.
